Graduou-se em CiÃªncia da ComputaÃ§Ã£o pela PUCRS em 1989, concluiu o mestrado tambÃ©m em CiÃªncia da ComputaÃ§Ã£o no PPGC-UFRGS em 1993 e o doutorado na EPFL, em Lausanne, SuiÃ§a, em 1998, sob a orientaÃ§Ã£o do Prof. Daniel Thalmann. Em 2005, realizou estÃ¡gio sabÃ¡tico de 2 meses na UniversitÃ© Paul Sabatier (IRIT) em Toulouse, FranÃ§a e atuou como professora convidada na UniversitÃ© catholique de Louvain (UCL), na BÃ©lgica, por outros 2 meses. Desde 1991 tem desenvolvido pesquisa nas Ã¡reas de animaÃ§Ã£o por computador, simulaÃ§Ã£o de humanos virtuais e mais recentemente em interaÃ§Ã£o nÃ£o-convencional, visualizaÃ§Ã£o e realidade virtual. RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Luciana Nedel works at Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul (UFRGS) where she has an assistant professor position since 2002. She is involved on education at Undergraduation and Graduation Courses on Computer Science and Computer Engineering. She is also supervising Undergraduate, Master and PhD students and making research in the Computer Graphics Group, at Institute of Informatics, UFRGS. Luciana is graduated in Computer Science at PUC-RS in 1989, concluded a master at the PPGC-UFRGS in 1993 and in 1998 received a Ph.D in Computer Science from Swiss Federal Institute of Technology (EPFL), Lausanne, Switzerland under the supervision of Prof. Daniel Thalmann. In 2005, she spent 2 months in sabbatical visit at UniversitÃ© Paul Sabatier (IRIT) in Toulouse, France and participated as invited professor at UniversitÃ© catholique de Louvain (UCL), Belgium, for another 2 months. Since 1991 she is involved in computer animation and virtual humans simulation researches and since 1996 also with virtual reality, non-conventional interaction and more recently visualization. In these fields, she published around 100 scientific articles in journals, conference Proceedings and edited books. Luciana has also participating in Technical Program Committees of relevant symposia, organization of scientific events and reviewing journal papers. Currently, she serves as editorial board member for the Visual Computer Springer journal, is the editor in chief of the SBC Journal on 3D Interactive Systems (JIS), and is the vice director of CEI (Center of Entrepreneurship on Informatics at UFRGS). She takes part on projects funded by government agencies such as CNPq and CAPES, and companies as HP and MIcrosoft. Nowadays her main research interests include: interactive visualization, non-conventional interaction techniques and devices, tiled displays, path-planning, games, virtual humans, and computer animation.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: SPIDERWeb - Specification and Prototyping for User Interface Design
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
SPIDER is an international project sponsorized by CAPES and COFECUB (CAPES/COFECUB - 399/02) whose main aim is to support the cooperation among researchers from LIIHS-IRIT (Toulouse, France) and Instituto de InformÃ¡tica-UFRGS (Porto Alegre, Brazil) on the investigation of models, tools and theories about Computer Human Interaction and Web.
The main goal of this project is to produce a framework for supporting the developpement of web applications with usability. In the core of this framework are methods to specify web design and describe user interface. We intend to bring together methods from a diversity of fields including: formal methods applied to computer human interaction, web visualization, task modeling, usability evaluation, guidelines and ergonomic rules for web design.
